>>What is the value of \(\lambda_{ii}\) in the \(\Lambda\) matrix?<<
( ) 1 (x) \(-\sum_{j\neq i} \lambda_{ji}\) ( ) 0
[Explanation] This is because each row of the \(\Lambda\) matrix must sum to zero. Thus, \(\lambda_{ii}\) is an expression of convenience, it is not a rate, nor a probability. [Explanation]
